fields.Title of Contribution: The Effects of Writing Interventions on Health and Mood in Undergraduates
fields.Description/Abstract:
My research partner, Dr. Cheryl Maddalena, and I are investigating how expressive writing techniques influence measures of physical and emotional health. In this study, we tested the effectiveness of writing interventions targeted to participants’ emotional processing level (EP) compared to a control writing condition. Undergraduates (N=64) were divided into high-EP and low-EP groups, then randomly assigned to complete three 20 minute writing interventions (“emotional disclosure” for high-EP, “best possible self” for low-EP) or control writing assignments. At four weeks post-intervention, “best possible self” and “emotional disclosure” conditions resulted in decreased need-based medical visits (Prob > F = 0.0127) and health symptoms (Prob > F = 0.0397) compared to controls. This pilot study indicates that using EP level to target writing interventions to preferred emotional processing style is a viable alternative to indiscriminant application of emotional disclosure interventions.
Partners:  Dr. Cheryl Maddalena
Description of Partner:  Research partners
Role:  Co-Principal
